content.textContent: Project Description

This project is a modern, front-end web application built with Angular and Symfony, designed to provide an optimized user experience through efficient rendering, dynamic content loading, and a well-structured component architecture. The application will be expanded by a back-end built in Symfony.
Key Features

Frontend: Angular with Vite for optimized builds
Styling: Tailwind CSS with custom themes
Component-based architecture for reusability and maintainability
Lazy loading to improve performance
SEO optimization with dynamic metadata handling
Responsive design with distinct mobile and desktop navigations
Custom directives, including an Intersection Observer-based viewport directive
Dynamic content loading using JSON

Backend: Symfony + MariaDB for data persistence
CRM & Admin section for managing customers and services
Challenges & Solutions
Intersection Observer Issue

Problem: While implementing lazy loading and viewport-based animations, we encountered an SSR-related error:
ERROR ReferenceError: IntersectionObserver is not defined

Solution:
Ensured that IntersectionObserver is only accessed in the browser environment.
Used Angular’s isPlatformBrowser check to prevent execution on the server.
Custom Swiper.js Integration
Problem: Dynamic image carousels were not initializing correctly due to asynchronous data loading.

Solution:
Used ngAfterViewInit to reinitialize Swiper once images were loaded.
Ensured Swiper instances were properly destroyed before reinitialization.

conclusion.summary: This project demonstrates a strong understanding of Angular’s core concepts, component-based architecture, and performance optimizations. It showcases problem-solving skills in debugging SSR-related issues, integrating external libraries, and designing a maintainable codebase.

content.textContent: Project Description

This project is a dynamic and interactive portfolio website built using vanilla JavaScript, the Bootstrap framework for styling and layout, and Swiper.js for creating image carousels. The website showcases a collection of media items.
Dynamic Content Loading and Filtering
The website dynamically loads and filters media items based on user-selected categories.  Swiper.js is used to create image carousels for projects with multiple media files.
Featured Media Rotation
Featured media items on the homepage rotate automatically every 5 seconds, showcasing different projects.

conclusion.summary: This project demonstrates the use of vanilla JavaScript, Bootstrap, and Swiper.js to create a dynamic and interactive portfolio website with features like dynamic content loading and a rotating featured media section.
